page.title: 05S.CROYDON CHIDHOOD _ 1900
page.content: It was alright but we had to walk miles to school,and there wasn't any wellingtons or anything like that.We would walk over a bridge _ the river flowed underneath and when it used to flood we walked through the water.When we got to the classroom we had to sit with our feet wet all day.We had to take some jam sandwiches for our lunch _we had a drink of water and some bread and jam for lunch and then, when it was all over we had to come home and walk through the water again 'cos it hadn't subsided by then.When we got home w changed, but we didn't have slippers to put on so we used to go bare feet.It was all cobblestones, but we got used to it. (Interview with a local lady)
